name: 真核生物多樣性與演化
goals: Understanding the evolutionary origin, history and diversity of eukaryotes and their genomes, organelles, biochemistry, cells, and organismic biology (Part I: Week 3–7)
Understanding major eukaryotic lineages and important eukaryotic microbes (Part II: Week 9–12, written assignment and oral presentation)
Understanding the relationships between eukaryotic microbes and Earth, ecosystems, humans, and other microbes (Part III: Week 13 (and 9–12) + assigned readings)
syllabus:
1：Introduction

2：Tools, techniques and methods

3：Originand early evolution of eukaryotes

4：Origin and early evolution of eukaryotes

5：Evolution of endosymbiotic organelles

6：Cellular structures

7：Metabolism, nutrition and cellular interactions; Cell cycle andlife cycle

8：Midterm exam

9：Opisthokonts, Amoebozoans

10：Archaeplastids

11：SAR

12：Haptists, Cryptists, Excavates and other eukaryotes

13：Protists, Earth and humans

14：Student presentations

15：Student presentations

16：Final exam

methodologies.note: 本課程將系統性的介紹真核生物的背景知識以及研究方法與技術
包含課堂提問與討論、學生之口頭報告與討論。

prerequisite: ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
